N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6500.2 - Definition of terms

State Regulations

As used in this Subtitle, the following terms shall have
the following meaning unless otherwise specified: (a) Advisory council shall mean the advisory
council of the New York State Office of Science, Technology and Academic

Research as established in Executive Law, article 10-B, section
209-b. (b) Award recipient shall
mean an academic institution of higher education that receives funds from the

Faculty Development Program through a contract with the State. (c) Contract shall mean the agreement between
the State and the award recipient approved by the Attorney General of the State
of New York and the Office of the State Comptroller. (d) Executive director shall mean the
executive director of the New York State Office of Science, Technology and

Academic Research. (e) Federal
assistance shall mean funds available, other than by loan, from the Federal
government, either directly, or through allocation by the State for program
purposes pursuant to any Federal law or program. (f) Match, matching share, or matching funds
shall mean the portion of the total cost of a project which the award recipient
must provide. Any match item may be donated by the recipient or reflect the
recipient's use for the project of such an item donated by a third party (such
as industry or alumni/ae). The match shall be no less than the State assistance
provided and will increase pursuant to the schedule set forth in section
6500.5
of this Part. The match is a
nonreimbursable component of the project's total cost and is reflective of the
award recipient's long-term commitment to the project. Items eligible to be
approved as match are items directly related to the purpose of the project, including, but not limited to: compensation for the recruited and/or retained
faculty member; support for research staff and graduate students who are
members of the faculty member's team; certain relocation expenses; preparing
and equipping the faculty member's work space; support for new faculty lines in
research areas to complement the recruited and/or retained faculty member and
his/her team; Federal assistance; donations from third parties; and the support
of an endowed chair that directly supports the entrepreneurial goals of the
project. Match must be expended during the contract term; however, NYSTAR, in
its sole discretion, may approve match expended no more than one year prior to
the application provided the recipient can demonstrate a direct relationship
between such expenditure and the project. (g) NYSTAR or office shall mean the New York

State Office of Science, Technology and Academic Research. (h) Primary host institution shall mean, in a
case where two or more institutions form a partnership or consortium of
research entities, the single institution which is designated to apply for and
administer the award. (i) Project
shall mean the scope of activities supported by State assistance and the award
recipient's matching share. (j) Project applicant or applicant shall mean an institution of higher education
and/or primary host institution within the State which applies for State
assistance pursuant to this Part. (k) Reimbursable expenses shall mean approved
costs incurred by the award recipient to perform the proposal. Reimbursable
expenses must be incurred during the contract term; however, NYSTAR, in its
sole discretion, may approve expenses incurred no more than one year prior to
the application provided the recipient can demonstrate a direct relationship
between such expense and the project. An item included as a match cannot also
be included as a reimbursable expense. That is, reimbursable expenses are
separate and independent of match. (l) Research Development Program shall mean
the program established by section 209-p of article 10-B of the Executive Law
to encourage and enhance the economic development role of academic institutions
in New York State. Such programs shall include, but not be limited to, the

Faculty Development Program, Capital Facility Program, the Incentive Program, and the Centers for Advanced Technology Development Program. (m) State assistance payment shall mean the
payment of monies by the State for projects authorized by section 209-p(3) of
title 10-B of the Executive Law. Notes
